wikipedia_page.main:
John Bryan (17 October 1841 – 24 June 1909) was an English cricketer.  Bryan was a right-handed batsman.  He was born at Lower Slaughter, Gloucestershire.
Bryan made two first-class appearances for Gloucestershire against Surrey and Sussex in 1873, scoring 34 runs at a batting average of 17.00, with a high score of 24.He died at Minchinhampton, Gloucestershire on 24 June 1909.

response: *John Bryan (MP) (by 1487 – 1524 or later), MP for Plymouth
*John Bryan (minister) (died 1676), Puritan ejected by the Act of Uniformity 1662
*John Bryan (art director) (1911–1969), Academy Award-winning art director
*John Bryan (diplomat), High Commissioner of the Cook Islands
*John Bryan (Wesleyan Methodist minister) (1776–1856), Welsh Wesleyan Methodist minister
As pen name: John Bryan was used as a pen name by Andrew Rothstein
